website_summaries.verdict: A well-made model with a spacious, comfortable design and a budget price.
pros: Has the capacity for a 17-inch laptop, accessories, and a camera
Padded dividers are movable for a custom fit
cons: It's big, and the interior padding isn't shockproof
For some users, the side pockets are too small to be very useful

customer_reviews.title: Zippers Depend on Gravity
customer_reviews.text: It's a great, cheap bag. It holds a ton of gear. But be _very careful_ when you pack it! Make sure all heavier gear (e.g., camera body, wide-angle lenses) are packed at the bottom. Things like flashes should be on top of those, and only very light items (e.g., remote triggers, flash sync cables) packed at the top. Otherwise, the outermost zipper (pictured) will open as soon as you put on the pack. The zipper just doesn't handle any kind of resistance. You get what you pay for. I'm still using it; don't get me wrong. But you should be aware of this before you potentially lose an expensive piece of kit falling out.
customer_reviews.author: A. Best

customer_reviews.title: tapered bag, dividers not adjustable
customer_reviews.text: The dimensions advertised are very wrong. further the bag is tapered on the sides and angled top and bottom. The "adjustable" dividers are also angled to fit the taper of the bag, so even if your gear managed to fit in the bag, you can't reconfigure the dividers significantly. Realistic internal dimensions of camera gear compartment, at opening: 14.5" H x 12" W at bottom x 4.5" Deep at bottom. At the top it is only 2.75" Deep. They claim 7.8" Internal. Even if they gave correct dimensions, this would be poor choice as it is almost non adjustable to the size of your gear.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: The backup works pretty well.
customer_reviews.text: Susanne lets the phone ring four times even when she's sitting right next to it. Susanne's lustrous hair is the result of skillful use of apple cider vinegar, half a can of beer, a hot oil treatment, and a shampoo actually intended for show horses. Susanne says that it's written into the Practiced Art Snob handbook that you can't be a fan of Andy Warhol, but you must claim to "respect his rejection of the Romantics." Susanne's nails are real and she does them herself in a process that involves narrow strips of masking tape. Susanne is an Aries who believes she'd fit better as a Cancer. I hope that this helps you better understand Susanne.
customer_reviews.author: Welby

customer_reviews.title: Won't Stay Closed
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't stay closed. Just picking it up makes the zippers come undone and it just dumps everything on the floor. I tried being careful with it but no matter what, the zippers open and things fall out. I've lost batteries and now my wallet because of this stupid thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a good value. The fabric is water resistant but I wouldn’t leave it in the rain and you definitely can’t submerge it or anything. It provides basic shock protection, but it’s not a hard case and can’t take being crushed or hit hard. The front accessory pocket is a little to thin for most photography accessories. Overall it’s a good value for the money, but probably not up to being your main camera bag if you’re a pro and/or have a lot of expensive and delicate equipment. For that, you really need an expensive camera bag or hard case.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: otherwise it is perfect for MTG
customer_reviews.text: If anyone here is wondering if this is suitable for Magic: The Gathering, it 100% is. Im able to fit an Ultimate Guard Quadrow in the laptop pocket, and 8 Ultimate Guard Sidewinders in the main pocket with room for a playmat. The only thing I wish it had was a water bottle pouch instead of one of the side pockets, otherwise it is perfect for MTG!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Welz

customer_reviews.text: It's: cheap, suuuper comfortable, durable, comes with a water repelling cover, has PLENTY of room and the orange contrasts with black outside real nice. I managed to fit a 15+ inch laptop and a charger, a mouse, drawing tablet, tripod, 2 DSLRs with 5 lenses, 2 reflectors, hoods, memory cards, chargers, speedlight and wireless transmitters, an L-sized hoodie, Bose wireless speaker with charger, keys, a few sharpies, wallet and a bunch of misc items like filters, etc. and there is still room left in this one... ) I mean this backpack is what ? 30 dollars? The only thing that comes to my mind is How is this so cheap!?
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Good camera bag!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a light casual amateur photographer, I don't use my gear frequently, but it goes with me on monthly weekend road trips. Several road trips, like about 4 so far, no noticeable wear. Can't speak to weather or rain resistance, idk if I'd want to trust this on a prolonged hike through a downpour. Maybe it will, but I'm not wanting to find out. Certainly, from the driveway or parking lot to my house, or any buiding, it will do the job. So far, no regrets, and I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BigTwinRider1964

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bag with plenty of padding and storage
customer_reviews.text: CONS:. Waist strap doesn't separate from bag Can get heavy No way to lock bag with locks PROS Sturdy design; comes with cover for rain Thick padding that's easily movable Nice amount of compartments Overall if you are looking for a good starter camera bag this one is awesome. Can hold a good amount of gear and doesn't feel cheaply made. Definitely recommend even though some improvements could be made to make it better.
customer_reviews.author: P. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Durable and huge space to work with. !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This bac pak was awesome. I carried 2 camera bodies (6D) /(50D) and 70-200,24-105,17-40 and 50 prime and a canon HD video camera with batteries for the 6D and 50D. Wow. I forgot rhe 1pad pro in the back with a Sony tripod - 60" capacity. It did weigh about 40 lbs but it held up wurh 8 trup in tge JR rail from Osaka to Nagabi abd more. This is worth its weigth in golf. Should have cost over $ 160.00+ but a steal at $40.00.
customer_reviews.author: MKST1

customer_reviews.title: It's really big
customer_reviews.text: This backpack was way too big for my use. I was looking at quite a few camera backpacks (specifically for those that hold a laptop and more in line with a budget option) so that my organization could buy 15 of them. We typically either hold 1 or 2 bodies, a lens, mic, tripod, laptop, couple extra batteries, etc. This was way too much space for that small amount of items. I also wasn't as big of a fan of all the extra waist straps and such. It just seemed like too much. Maybe that's what you are looking for though! Quality seemed good, overall good backpack if you are looking for something big and bulky.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Schaefer

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality product at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Pleasantly surprised by this backpack. When I ordered it, because of the price, I was expecting something pretty cheap to arrive. This backpack is made of high quality materials inside and out. The zippers are large and heavy duty. Lots of adjustable compartments to securely store all your camera gear, and as a bonus it has a dedicated zippered compartment for a laptop. Love finding great deals like this. I would definitely recommend this backpack without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Milovich

customer_reviews.title: Well made camera bag, but it didn't have any ...
customer_reviews.text: Well made camera bag, but it didn't have any storage pockets for memory cards or batteries so I made one out of left over piece of velcro [to attache it to the inside of the main compartment] and bungee. The side pockets can hold 2 Storacell by Powerpax AA Battery Caddy each.
customer_reviews.author: H. Csuri

customer_reviews.title: Great for storing magic cards.
customer_reviews.text: I know this is a DSLR/Laptop/Gadget backpack, but I use this to hold my Magic: The Gathering decks, my trade binder, my playmats, and my dice. I can fit ~8 decks in the backpack, 2 playmats in playmat tubes, my completely full trade binder, and my dice bag. It can fit a whole lot of cards in this bag, and I love it. disclaimer: I bought a bag, and the right shoulder strap buckle was backwards so you couldn't tighten the strap because the buckle's teeth were facing outward instead of inward. I exchanged it for a new backpack and the new one so far works like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Albert Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great Value, but not for forever
customer_reviews.text: I got this bag in 2015 and have used it extensively. It's very roomy and sucks up all sorts of cameras, gear, laptops, food, jackets, etc. I will say that the structure of the bag does sag after time. The camera dividers pull away because the sides move around. It's really an amazing value. But, after 5 years of heavy use, both zippers have started to fail. I like this bag! Honestly, I'll look for a bag of the same size and same layout. But I may look for a bag with more structure.
customer_reviews.author: ColoPeltier

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile, price is great.
customer_reviews.text: You can load a lot of gear in here. Here’s what I packed for a weekend shoot. NikonD3s body, Nikon D2h body. Nikon 80-200mm f 2.8 lens. Sigma 17-55mm lens, Nikon SB-800 flash, Nikon Flash battery pack, Hoodman Loupe, Audo Techica 15” stereo microphone. Nikon 80-400 mm lens. 36 AA batteries and charger, 2 spare EN-EL4 batteries 21 filters, IPad Pro 9.7”. Total weight was 41 pounds. It’s great for transporting gear, but unlike a traditional bag you’v Got to set it down to get your gear out. That’s the weakness of any backpack bag. This is a great bag at a great price
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy L. Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Nice budget photography backpack.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice backpack that can hold most of my smaller equipment. Right now I have two Nikon bodies (D7200 & D750), with four lenses (70-300, 50, 18-140 DX, 24-120) that all fit in their just fine. I don't have room to put my speedlites, unfortunately. It also holds my Surface pro 2, along with some smaller things (flash triggers, SD cards, chargers). Tripod strap is nice, but I don't feel I can strap in my tripod as securely as I'd like to, but it's not going anywhere. I'm a little worried about the quality of the stitching's and zippers. I've taken the bag out with my equipment a couple times and has held up fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: Nick H

customer_reviews.title: Your stuff will be safe in there - but that's about it
customer_reviews.text: The protective padding is good and it should protect the stuff you put in there (know that it comes at the cost of storage space but that is expected). Also, know there's no pocket for a water bottle. I find the waist strap to be pretty useless since it falls around most people's stomach rather than waist, so it mostly just gets in the way in my opinion without being able to offer support. With or without the waist strap, I don't find it comfortable to wear, especially if you have heavy gear in there. I also had 2 zippers break off through normal use. The laptop pocket is nice though - easily fits a 15inch laptop.
customer_reviews.author: kangar0012

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Bag At the Perfect Price
customer_reviews.text: I was in the market for a camera bag because I have amassed quite a bit of gear and transporting it to shoots was becoming a problem. All the bags I was looking at had exorbitant prices but Amazon came in clutch. This thing is able to carry my Canon 5D Mark III, batter grip, lenses, a tripod and my 15.6" ThinkPad safely. The chest and waist strap is helpful for when it gets heavy. The bag itself also looks very stylish (I got the one with the orange interior). It isn't waterproof but there is a cover.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Really nice bag if you need the large storage capacity
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic bag to hold a DSLR camera with a generous amount of accessories. I use this bag to hold my camera body, 7 lenses (albeit a couple of them are very small), an external microphone, and various other items (batteries, wireless shutter release, cleaning gadgets, filters, etc.). I don't use the laptop compartment at this time, but it's nice to have if I need it later. My only real complaint about this bag is that I wish it had a couple of loops on the sides of the exterior to clip on some other accessories that have their own storage bags (such as my hot-shoe flash). Instead, I'm using the tripod straps for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: JinLA

customer_reviews.title: Best backpack yet
customer_reviews.text: I was super thrilled that this backpack exceeded my expectations. Without any trouble, I can load my 600mm lens in it and my Canon 7D camera, in addition to other lenses and accessories -- AND my laptop AND a small tripod. I am so thrilled with this thing. The only reason I don't have a picture for you is because my daughter is loaning it for her college trip to AZ. :)
customer_reviews.author: SandysConnected

customer_reviews.title: I am happy with it
customer_reviews.text: The photo backpack is larger than my other one and I needed something larger. There is room for 2 cameras, lenses and peripheral items. Additionally, there is a zippered sleeve where I can store a laptop and some papers. It is reasonably high quality and meets my needs. I know I am too picky, but am not crazy about the small rubber "Amazon Basics" logo on the back but I used a permanent black marker to color the white lettering and it is not noticeable. I used Amazon regularly but I do not feel like being a walking advertisement for them.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M in Tucson

customer_reviews.title: Need some space in the zipper pulls to attach a lock
customer_reviews.text: It's a very nice and spacious camera bag that can accommodate several lenses, flashes and other photography gear. The padded compartment to put a 15" laptop, or maybe a tablet, is a nice addition. My only complaint is there are no openings in the zippers to lock the compartments. Recently I went on a vacation to Cancun and it would have been nice to be able to attach a small lock to the zippers.
customer_reviews.author: Rashid

customer_reviews.title: Good DSLR backpack
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a backpack for my T6i and lenses for hiking and such when the overshoulder Canon bag I have gets tiring to wear. This backpack has good cushion on the straps that makes it very comfortable over long periods, and the extra straps for across the waist and chest help to hold it on place nicely while hiking. The laptop slot will sometimes open on my whole wearing if I leave the two zippers at the top of the backpack instead of moving them both down to one side. While that is a bit annoying, I am okay with it.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Garcia

customer_reviews.title: as I  expected,  perfect
customer_reviews.text: it's very very nice with good materials, it fits my mirrorless camera (sony a7iii ) , my four lenses (sony 85 , sony 12-24 G , sony zeiss 55 , sony 70-200 GM) , and a lens ball , and sony camera Cyber-shot RX100 VI , and there is still one room !!,, wow ,, what else can I say !! I really like it, and recommend to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: Get this! This holds a ton of equipment and some!
customer_reviews.text: It is spacious, and holding: Canon 5D mark II Canon 24-70 mm lens Canon 7D with 50 mm Godox power pack Canon 70-200 mm Canon 580 EX II - I stacked two of those in the slot (rightmost slot) Plus around 12 batteries And it has more space to hold other smaller things. It is perfect for carrying everything I need for a photoshoot in one bag. It is surprisingly cheap for such a spacious and well made bag. My verdict: get it without a doubt.
customer_reviews.author: I_Say_It_Like_It_Is

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe Amazon can sell this great backpack for the low price they do. I use it to carry/store my Xiro XplorerV with all accessories. Due to the adjustability of the padded sections I was able to fit the quad very snugly as well as all the accessories. And empty it is very light weight so doesn't add much to the carry weight.
customer_reviews.author: JES

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but BIG
customer_reviews.text: Super sturdy, well padded, and you can put a TON of stuff in it. Works well for weekend trips. But as a day pack, it’s very bulky. I used it for eight weeks in Europe, and generally found it too large (and hot!) to tote around all the time. If you need to take a ton of gear, or if you need your camera, laptop, jacket, lunch, notebook, cat, small car and personal library with you at all times, I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this backpack
customer_reviews.text: Upgrades to a backpack from a sling case. This bag seems to-be great quality, has great paddings & lots of room. It is larger then I thought but that will not be a problem. Some have complained about the bottom strap being higher then the natural waist but I like that it keeps the weight of the pack on my upper back, not lower back or shoulders. Haven't hiked with it yet. I'll update if I come across any cons.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Murray

customer_reviews.title: holds my Nikon camera, 3 lenses, flashes and other equipment and is comfortable to wear
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this AmazonBasics DSLR and Laptop Backpack for my daughters Nikon D5300. It is overkill for her since she is just starting photography. There is lots of room and the dividers can be placed into different positions to accommodate your equipment. I am going to buy another one of these for my equipment. My camera, 3 lenses, flashes, filters, and all my other accessories fit nicely. The shoulder straps and back area are nicely padded for comfort. There is also a chest strap to connect the shoulder straps and a waist strap that adds even more comfort.
customer_reviews.author: Annette G

customer_reviews.title: Not for the street photographer.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is huge. It is way beyond big enough for the modest photographer. I also personally found the zippers stiff and prone to snagging and the camera compartment access requires taking the bag off and laying it down on a flat surface. The tripod loops are also really huge and largely useless unless you carry a studio grade tripod. If, fact his bag is probably best for a studio photographer. As a street photographer, I've found it too slow, too heavy, and too cumbersome. I'm probably going to return this for something smaller and more easily accessible.
customer_reviews.author: Spenser Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Great bag, Can carry a ton of gear.
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this thing is awesome. I’ve been a professional photographer for over 10 years and have gone thru a half dozen bags but I think I found the keeper. It has tons of storage, I’m able to fit my full frame canon, 4 extra lenses, flash units, batteries and even the laptop. Sure it gets heavy with more you put in it but isn’t that true for all bags!? Don’t hesitate, buy it. It’s cheap and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua B.

customer_reviews.title: Great solution for me at the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great backpack for the great price. The material and durability are quite impressive for the price. I wasn’t expecting $300 quality for one 10th the price. If you plan to do heavy backpacking then maybe you been the more robust model. But I don’t and this works great. Nice insides, functional and versatile design. My only question is how long the tripod holder will last befor the material starts to rip or fail. But then I’ll jist buy a new one at this price.
customer_reviews.author: Beaugy

customer_reviews.title: Good for lighter setups.
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like the bag for the money. I purchased for short term use until a good deal on a high end bag came along. One of the pull tabs has already come off but that’s not huge. Here is the only MAJOR issue..... if the laptop compartment zipper is at the top it can open allowing the bag to fall back. What that said my set up is not light so for someone who has a lighter kit it might not be a issue. All in all it’s a great budget bag.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect photography EDC bag
customer_reviews.text: I now use this as my primary EDC bag. It carries my DSLR, 3 lenses, my portable HDD, many of my most commonly used photography accessories, my cellphone charger, headphones, notebook, pens, keys, business cards, and MacBook and is still comfortable to carry in to work and around town. I wouldn't want to go on hike with this much gear, but for my every day needs, its perfect. I do think the shoulder pads are stitched on a bit weakly, but if they do fail, I'm sure I can either get them repaired by any good seamstress/luggage repair shop, or if I really want to, buy another bag since they're pretty inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: Eric. D

customer_reviews.title: It’s big and well made.
customer_reviews.text: For $32 this is a steal. I bought it for a trip overseas to take my 5D and 3 lenses (50, 28-135 and a 2.8 14mm) I also got batteries charger, laptop (15.1) charger, card reader, headphones, iPad, small point and shoot, shoulder strap..... you get the picture, it’s big. Construction feels good, fully loaded it’s comfortable and feels safe. Take the amazon basics label off and no one will know it’s a 30 dollar bag. I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: El Presidente

customer_reviews.title: Very good bag but be wary of dimensions
customer_reviews.text: The bag is well made and keeps everything organized and neat. The internal dividers can be arranged to any configuration you need. The zippers and straps are sturdy. The one thing to be careful of is that the dimensions (specifically depth) are not accurate. The layers of padding remove 1-2 inches of usable space. I had an item that needed the full depth of the bag. In order to make it fit, I had to remove one of the padding layers.
customer_reviews.author: L A

customer_reviews.title: Solid backpack
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a boatload of bags for my wife's camera an accessories. In order to stay in the price range I wanted I kept having to give up feature or another. Otherwise I was looking to jump up another 20 or 30 dollars. This had almost everything I wanted in a bag for her and when I got it, it did not disappoint. The quality of the bag I received is great! Rearranging the dividers is a breeze and this was worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Brent A. VanSteenkiste

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag..
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice bag, especially for the price. It is a large bag and holds just about all of my Nikon D7100 gear. The shoulder and waist straps are heavy duty and comfortable. It is constructed well and it's a good thing because fully loaded it is heavy. Too heavy for backpacking or hiking but great for when you need to bring everything and keep it safe and secure.
customer_reviews.author: RedSled

customer_reviews.title: UNBEAtABLE for the price!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIFIC Value! I recently kitted myself up with a Canon EOS80D and four Canon lenses ranging in focal length from 10 to 300mm, and a Canon 430EX III-RT Speedlite, lens hoods, a Leitz minipod, a Sony 6' tripod, and a large assortment of accessories from 40 years of taking pictures, and still have a lot of room to spare! The straps - one across the chest, and another across the lower midriff, are intelligently placed and have quick-release connections. The tripod has easily-adjustable straps on the right side, to easily let it tide along, as part of the pack. If you also have a good-sized kit, I urge you to try this bag. It's a winner!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: As a beginner photographer, this bag is incredible. I'm sure we'd all love a Peter McKinnon Nomadic bag, but for a budget friendly option this bag is better than the price suggests. I currently have a DSLR body, 4 lenses, filters, lens hoods, cleaning kit, external battery, reflectors, and few other random things; the bag handles it perfectly and still has a sleeve in the back that fits my 15in laptop. The waist and chest straps help distribute the weight well. Great value for the price and a solid beginner bag.
customer_reviews.author: Sean McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Not deep enough
customer_reviews.text: The top of the bag is more shallow than the bottom. The camera has to be at the bottom due to this and not at the top for easier access. It isn’t deep enough for a camera with a battery pack - I can get the bag to close, but not comfortably. The straps on the back are bulky and not comfortable to wear. It’s a good bag for the price, but not for a professional or a hiker who would be wearing it for an extended amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella K.

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant bag. I love it. It fits all my camera gear. I got two cameras and a few lenses plus a ton of accessories as well and everything fits with room to spare. The laptop compartment is very generous and the side pouches are a bit small but manageable. The adjustable slots inside are very convenient. The padding is sufficient and all the safety straps to keep it on your body makes it feel very secure. If I could change anything I would add more accessory pouches but it's not a dealbreaker I still love this bag very much. Much more affordable than the other brands I love Amazonbasics because of this.
customer_reviews.author: PeteTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Best $40 Camera Bag
customer_reviews.text: I honestly was not expecting this bag to impress me. My camera bag recently broke and I needed a cheap quick replacement so I ordered the Amazon Basics camera bag. This thing is solid. Padding all around. I love that it has a laptop sleeve. My only concern is the zipper. I've had other bags with this type of zipper fail but they were all over $100 USD. Being that it is a $40 dollar bag who cares lol. I can't wait to bring this bag out and abuse it. I'll add any updates as soon as the come. First impressions - Buy before they increase the price x)
customer_reviews.author: Kev

customer_reviews.title: Camera on the move
customer_reviews.text: First carrying backpack that I’ve purchase for a camera and I made the right choice. Definitely a great investment since I’ve experienced sling backpacks that just didn’t workout for me. I tend to carry many things with me and this has helped organize my camera equipments. Definitely a good buy if you’re looking for a camera backpack that won’t hurt your wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Uly

customer_reviews.title: Content with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very roomie. Nicely compartmentalized. Can really carry a lot. I loaded it up to the fullest when I was taking lots of new gear home in Burundi and I had it as my hand luggage. By the end of the journey (28hr flight) I could feel that my shoulders had worked out pretty good. Had it been a few hours of me carrying it around I probably would have been fine. Another plus is that it feels really sturdy and good and does not look cheap at all! Price is good too for those qualities so go buy!
customer_reviews.author: Anny

customer_reviews.title: has been working out great! Only problem I have with the bag is ...
customer_reviews.text: So many compartments, has been working out great! Only problem I have with the bag is the top part of the handle came loose after about 15 day of use. I did have my 70d along with 2 lenses, my laptop, and my iPad in it. It is possible i may have had it packed too much, but I wasn't always holding it by the top grip. Since I usually carry it with the back strap, I will just use it and have my aunt saw it back on since she owns a taylor shop, but it would've been better if it is sealed perfectly. Still would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: kkdllsjjfie

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price. Seems durable enough, has ample dividers, has plenty of pouches, and wears fairly securely. I got it simply to have more space; the fact that it can be worn as a backpack was just a bonus. Plus, it has tripod straps to carry your tripod, although I would recommend small/light tripods as it quickly lists to the side. The zippers aren't the most industrial but seem durable enough. I don't plan on using this one to hike or go on backwood recon missions.
customer_reviews.author: micah

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT bag. I've only had it a couple days ...
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT bag. I've only had it a couple days but it is exactly what I wanted for well under half the price of comparable products. Quality appears to be very high, we'll see how it hold up after I begin to put it through the ringer. Foam separators stick very well for customization and there are plenty of pockets. My 17" laptop fits into the laptop area but its pretty snug. My laptop may be 17.1" but if there is going to be any problems with zippers it looks like here is where the weakness will be given that its pretty tight.
customer_reviews.author: JimH

customer_reviews.title: Sold, plenty of room and looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I managed to fit inside this bag : - Nikon D600 - 7 Lenses ( from a 50mm 1.8 to the biggest I have, a 24-85 f3.5/4 ) - extra batteries - bunch of lens filter - flash / remote triggers And I still have room ! Construction is really solid, the 3 way straps are perfect for long hikes. Only little cons is that you can't really fit nicely a decent size tripod. Maybe have straps on the bottom of the bags would be better than on it's side ? Regardless, it's a great DSLR bag.
customer_reviews.author: dc.arock

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck
customer_reviews.text: Great case for anything, ample space whether you're packing a camera, 2 cameras, or for a week long trip. The velcro dividers are sturdy to pad your equipment and hold them securely, and the velcro straps are a nice bonus to further secure your devices. Laptop pouch is nice and large to fit bulkier laptops and the outside pouch is great for accessories like extra batteries, sd cards, etc. Great budget backpack, would definitely reccommend you buy if you're looking for a nice backpack on a budget.
customer_reviews.author: Richard chang

customer_reviews.title: Very good bag
customer_reviews.text: Overall the bag fulfilled its purpose of being able to store and transport a variety of camera equipment. It was a gift for my girlfriend, and she was able to fit in: 2 smaller lenses, 1 very large 150-600 mm telephoto lens, camera body, array of filters, extra battery and charger. The divisions made packing the bag easy, and there was room to fit plenty more. The orange interior was a hidden blessing, making it very easy to see the contents. The straps for the tripod were effective. The only negative is the bulk of that bag, but this is expected for such a capable bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mikey 'Killer'

customer_reviews.title: Great sturdy camera bag that is just the right size.
customer_reviews.text: I love this camera bag. I have a Canon EOS 5 DS R 50.6 cameraand four "L" lenses. They all fit in it perfectly. It carries my "necessities" in a shoot that I might need to change lenses. Because I knew I would never use it as a backpack I cut off the straps. It's made well, very strong material, it has other compartments for cards, filters, paperwork etc.
customer_reviews.author: Robbin

customer_reviews.title: Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I needed some more room for some coming lenses. The bottom is wider and deeper to hold two mirrorless DSLMs on the bottom, and short lenses to go in standing up. Multiple layers on the front and a 15”+ laptop in the back, to large reflectors/diffusers. The hiking straps are well positioned. A tripod can be strapped on a side. Very much like the $250+ brand name bags. The top in is tapered as is the vertical dividers, so you probably won’t put a camera body on the top.
customer_reviews.author: PilotJimL

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year old & the backpack straps are falling apart/tearing away from the backpack itself
customer_reviews.text: The backpack itself it good at the price point and flexibility but it doesnt have a water bottle holder and the straps are not very durable. Less than a year and they are falling apart and tearing away from the backpack itself. I am looking for a new backpack currently
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Holds cam, lenses, flash, clothes and laptop
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used this on a real trip yet, but it holds my camera, lenses, flash, some clothes and my laptop. Slightly bigger and (I think) better constructed than others I looked at. * * * UPDATE: I flew with this cross-country. I had a Nikon 7100 with a Tamron 18-400 lens, and a Nikon 3300 with an 18-270 lens, plus two lenses I didn't bother to take out of the bag. I also took my HP 17" laptop and charger. My wife was amazed how heavy the bag was when she picked it up, but when you've got the waist strap fastened, it rides like a dream. Great camera & laptop case!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comically large on a normal sized person
customer_reviews.text: The bag itself functions really well. It’s well organized and fits more than what I needed for a small pro setup (canon 5D and a few lenses). The problem is, the bag is so wide it looks comically large on an averaged size person. I’m a 5’8 guy and can only imagine this bag looking normal on a large male over 6’3 tall. I look like a kindergartener wearing an adult’s backpack. I’ll still use it because of the aforementioned functionality but I’ll look weird doing so
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!! I have a couple cameras and some ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic!! I have a couple cameras and some lenses that I've been looking for an easier way to tote around (I was just shoving everything in my laptop bag :/), and this is it! Fits all my filters, speedlites/accessories, extra batteries, memory cards, spot for hanging keys, and even my 15.6" laptop for Lightroom on the go. Very comfortable to wear and seems very durable. Came with a rain fly. For times when I need it all, this will be my go-to bag. I checked out the caselogic one in store (for $99.99) and I like the amazon basic version better! The bright interior makes it easier to find what you need in low light as well. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Misti MoonshineTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Superbly designed backpack
customer_reviews.text: AmazonBasics products all have been excellent in my experience. This backpack is no exception. Nicely packaged on arrival, this attractive product has good material, good zippers, well-organized interior pockets and handy exterior pockets. My 17.3" HP laptop (just) fits. There are enough velcro-attachable dividers in the main compartment for most any combination of camera-lens-accessories. Particularly nice is the fact that this compartment unzips all the way down the backpack, making it ultra-easy to put things in and take things out. I myself often remove the dividers and use this compartment as a suitcase for clothes and even shoes. It is hard to imagine a better designed, better made backpack than this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rodavan

customer_reviews.title: Lots of packing space does not fit under airline seat properly
customer_reviews.text: This backpack has tons of room. Whoever wrote a review for it fitting under an airline seat is terribly wrong. Confortable to wear tons of packing space for camera amd gear and laptop plus lots more. Good heavy duty quaity. I really have to love something emensly for 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Tom and kendra

customer_reviews.title: Don't be in a hurry
customer_reviews.text: If you're not carrying too much, then this will work. I only have 4 lenses, camera, 2 hoods, 2 battery chargers, harnest, cleaning kit, etc....Plus there are other compartments to still use. The only issue I have is keeping these items from moving around. The velcro doesn't seem to hold all of them in place. Otherwise, 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jess G.

customer_reviews.title: Eh..
customer_reviews.text: The bag is great! But one consistent issue i've had with this bag is that when you grab it from the handle up top, it pulls the top of the bag up and so any velcro inside that is attached to that top part of the bag will detach. This often results in the inside getting all messed up and things all out of order. It is a great bag for the most part but unless you decide you never grab the top handle or permanently attach the velro to the top, it may make a mess of the inside. Also, the Velcro for all the inside pieces have gone bad on me and no longer stay together.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley George

customer_reviews.title: Merry popins would be proud.
customer_reviews.text: Totally awesome. The bag seems better then a bag I bought before that was twice as much money. I did have to sew another devider to make it do what I wanted (the red one) but that was not difficult for someone with moderate sewing skills. I'm able to fit so much into this bag it's amazing. Update: I've used this bag in the field now. The material resists the snow very well.
customer_reviews.author: Review Tech Now

customer_reviews.title: Padded to protect your gear
customer_reviews.text: Holds most of my gear- 2 Canon 35mm cameras; 7 lenses; flash; cleaners; filters; and yes, film. Only my tripod and 650-1300mm telephoto lens don't fit but I can strap them on to the backpack. You can rearrange the interior pads to suit your needs.This backpack offers you nice, easy access to your camera(s) and lenses- no need to remove anything to get to the lenses below. And it is nicely padded to protect your investment. I will be recommending this to anyone who asks.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Gallien

customer_reviews.title: So awesome if you need your camera and laptop together!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I take photos for our church, then burn them on a CD for the pastor, the person getting baptised, the family at the child dedication, basically whatever is going on - this was soooo great to just have one backpack to carry it all in! Before, I had my camera bag, my laptop bag, my purse and my tablet carrier. This holds my laptop, CDs, cords, mouse, Camera, my 3 lenses, Quackers (my stuffed duck for getting kids' attention) and my tablet and phone - and I still have room left over for paperwork! If you ever need to be portable with camera and laptop - this is the bag for you!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jewely

customer_reviews.title: BEST camera/backpack ever & great $$$ value
customer_reviews.text: Absolute best $$$ value in a camera case. Holds 2 mirrorless SONY cameras & 5 lenses with no problem. Also holds all my misc. camera equipment inside including 3 studio & outdoor lighting screens. Compartments well thought out and bright orange interior so I can get to what I want/need easily without having to dig through everything. Padded perfectly so it's comfortable to carry on your back. Well made, does not appear to be anything but good quality construction. Just got it so if it falls apart or anything negative happens I'll update this review. BUY ONE WHILE THEY ARE STILL AVAILABLE. It always seems like things this good are not available long term.
customer_reviews.author: vvv

customer_reviews.title: Its goid. Could be great
customer_reviews.text: It's a great bag and it fits all my camera gear very nicely I just wish it had more pockets especially on the front. I feel like they had the Room and just didnt bother. It does fit my giant 17" laptop though which is the reason I bought it and 90% of the other bags do not fit it. So its 50/50 for me.
customer_reviews.author: @Jeffcohnphoto

customer_reviews.title: High quality, excellent price, very highly recommended (so good I own two)
customer_reviews.text: Love the first one so much I bought a second. The first one I bought holds my Canon cameras, lenses, flash, spare batteries, remote triggers, etc. When I bought my drone I order a second bag to hold the Mavic Pro, controller, spare batteries, charger, extra rotor blades, etc. I customized the interior partitions in both bags to fit all my equipment perfectly. This is a high quality bag at a very reasonable price. Very highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Walker, Reviewer and Artist

customer_reviews.title: The only thing Basic is the name
customer_reviews.text: I know what you are thinking- Amazon basics?? That is what I first thought but this is a good solid bag. It has a bright orange interior and is fully customizable via high quality Velcro. This has become my go to bag when I need to carry lots of equip. Fits perfectly as a carry on and has enough straps that you do not have to worry about it dropping. It also has side straps for Tripod use.
customer_reviews.author: Mike S

customer_reviews.title: Backpack
customer_reviews.text: It is not water proof you have to carry the cover to male it water proof.... I liked that it was compact but I can carry 2 cameras and several lenses... Plus extra accessories. Didn't really like the thin felt material inside nor the color but to carry my equipment when out and about... It's good.
customer_reviews.author: d. osorto

customer_reviews.title: Great for drones
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use as a drone bag from my DJI Phantom 3 Advance. There are youtube videos out there showing some decent arrangements to get the drone nice and snug inside. Everything fits, but it's a tight fit. Though the bag is getting a little worn in now and closes up easier than the first day I used it. Highly recommended for people who want a cheap drone backpack. It's comfy enough to get from the car to wherever you are gonna launch your drone, but I haven't worn it for more than an hour or so at a time - so I can't comment on a longer hike.
customer_reviews.author: Sundance

customer_reviews.title: Versatile Large Backpack Bag
customer_reviews.text: Spacious bag that can hold a large DSLR, several lens, a flash and accessories. Has room for a 17" laptop as well. High build quality with movable dividers and comfortable shoulder straps. I do wish there was an external water bottle holder and a way to secure the many straps and cross straps when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Even the MEDIUM size backpack is HUMONGOUS!!
customer_reviews.text: If I had a third (and, maybe, fourth) camera - or the same number of lenses to pack, this backpack would have been perfect. But, for my Nikon D5???, my P510 and my W300 and ONE additional lens, the thing is WAY TOO BIG - - and BULKY!! Material and construction seemed fine - - but I elected to send it back and went with a sling-style pack.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: I'm a hobbyist (not a professional) and recently used this bag to take my DSLR to a couple overseas destinations. It's a large backpack for sure, but not too large to carry on to even the smallest of planes. The compartments are customizable to fit around an array of photography gear, and my 13" macbook fits in the back with room to spare. The tripod straps are a useful addition as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kosoku

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS BAG
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THIS BAG, So here it is, the picture if from my channel I did a review on it. (Nativemags unlimited) YouTube if you want to check it out. I love the bag, holds my 15inch laptop, my camera and accessories, my tripod and my drone. Cant ask for more. Haven't had any issue and the quality seems good. Different recommend. Plenty of storage.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan magliazzo

customer_reviews.title: Function not fancy
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Amazon Basics camera backpack. The first is still going strong, and the new one is home to another camera. It's not fancy, but it's very functional, and the extra back pocket allows me to carry a laptop along when traveling. It's durable, flexible, and a great bargain compared to other camera backpacks I priced.
customer_reviews.author: wld1

customer_reviews.title: Great way to store your SLR
customer_reviews.text: I bought this backpack after reading all the great reviews. The price was right and the product did not disappoint. I had an older backpack that I mostly use for storage but it was just a little bit too small. This backpack fits it all - multiple lenses, flash, and all my cables. Great for storage and also convenient that when I go somewhere I can bring all my equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Johan

customer_reviews.title: Holds what I wanted it to hold.
customer_reviews.text: Actually this is a pretty nice bag especially for the money. I needed a bag to carry a DSLR/grip, and a 70-200mm, 15-30mm and a 24-70mm lens at the same time. This pack does this and I still have room for a few accessories, Construction is adequate for travel by car and in city or short hiking trips. I would not use this for extensive airline travel of other rugged outdoor use. Due to this I gave it 4 stars. Nice pack.
customer_reviews.author: Larry H.

customer_reviews.title: nice padded straps
customer_reviews.text: I really dig this bag. To be honest, I've bought a few other Basics items before (mostly cables, etc) but I didn't have immensely high expectations for this bag. Think again. This is everything I need out of a photo bag. Padded for my laptop, movable organizational sections, pockets to separate papers from other items, nice padded straps, and a tripod holder. I have all of my gear, easily found (due to the organizational features), in a secure, padded bag. Very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: whereismymind

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack especially for the price. I use this exactly as described, and fits much more than just my laptop and DSLR and lenses. Inner compartmentalized area is adaptable for various uses. So far it's quality in construction and durable. I've taken it on many trips. My only complaint is that there's little padding between your back and your laptop, so if you're out on a trek, it becomes uncomfortable. Cinch belt helps somewhat. I'm completely satisfied otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Kreider

customer_reviews.title: I couldn't be happier with this camera bag
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier with this camera bag. I have a DSLR and several lenses and lots of accessories including shoe mount flash, everything fits into this bag and has it's own place. The bag seems to be well padded so I never have a fear of my camera being damaged while in the bag. The backpack style is what drew me to this product and I am very glad that I decided to purchase this item. The backpack allows me to snap photo's while walking around and I still have all of my gear securely behind me. This would be an excellent bag for a novice photographer all the way up to a professional photographer.
customer_reviews.author: James Wegmann

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag for use in transit
customer_reviews.text: I used the Amazon Basics DSLR Camera and Laptop Backpack Bag to carry two DSLRs with all of the adapters, chargers, extra batteries converter, tablet and a small plastic bag of toiletries fit comfortably in this bag. When visiting sites, I used a smaller bag (Peak Design 10 L) which I packed in my stowed luggage which I could also carry two DSLRs in. The AmazonBasics DSLR Camera and Laptop Backpack Bag is comfortable to carry, fits in the overhead storage and is padded well enough to protect the contents from other bags banging into it. I recommend using this bag to travel with and bring a smaller bag for daily excursions.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It holds all my stuff.
customer_reviews.text: This seems fairly well made although I've just loaded it with my camera equipment and cannot speak to the long term durability of this backpack. There are a lot of different ways to configure the inside thanks to the moveable Velcro dividers. I have A LOT of different lenses, filters and accessories and managed to get everything in there though it weighs a lot. However I do like the fact that it has the chest and waist belts so you are not constantly readjusting to keep it on. I really like the orange interior because you can actually see everything at a glance and it makes finding things a lot easier. Overall this is a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Seagal45

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This fits my Nikon d5600, wide angle lens (12-20mm), zoom (70-300mm), & regular (18-55mm) lenses as well as my GoPro and a MacBook Pro plus a ton of other accessories (lens covers, cords, cleaning supplies, etc.). Lightweight and comfortable...
customer_reviews.author: MGilly247

customer_reviews.title: No places for water bottle(s) and very limited external attachments
customer_reviews.text: The major weakness of this backpack after purchasing and I didn't notice right away was no standard water bottles holder. There are the two pockets on the sides, but not really deep or wide enough for a large bottle water, nor to securely attach it. If you go on a shoot, must have H2O! Camera straps were also a little flaky, would have preferred straps on both sides and on the bottom as well. I ended up not using this backpack too much because those issues made it very limited usability.
customer_reviews.author: Anh N.

customer_reviews.title: Zippers zip well
customer_reviews.text: One of the main pleasures of this bag is the smoothness of the zippers. Plenty of room for camera, lens and other things. Convenient zipper pouch in bag to hold iPad, pencils and maybe some polarizers. Over all, this is a good bag and should last quite awhile.
customer_reviews.author: W. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Another great Amazon Basics Product!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, you cannot go wrong and of course... It is an Amazon Basic product. The bag appears to be in great quality with good stitching. I have given the product a pretty good test already by taking it hiking to get pictures of the Colorado Sunrise over the mountains and it held up excellent. Comes with a cover to use when it is raining or snowing which was a great help. Kept the bag dry and even helped when having to set it down on the ground when working on taking pictures. In fact, two of my co-workers have also made the purchase after seeing mine!
customer_reviews.author: D.P.

customer_reviews.title: Actually better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical buying this. I've taken in on a couple trips across country and I'm pretty happy with it. It is pretty well padded. and keeps my DSLR secure. The lenses, not so much. But this can be fixed with some additional double sided velcro. I've been carrying a 15" Chromebook in this, versus my ASUS RoG laptop because with the gear, the space is very tight for the thickness of my big laptop. The outer-most space is nice to carry additional small items. I would have like to see more pockets on the outside of this, but for the money, I can do without. The straps are very well padded and is a very comfortable bag to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Geoff P

customer_reviews.title: I rarely write reviews, I had to write a review about this backpack.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a recent trip from St. Paul to Albuq. and back again. I needed to pack two work laptops, iPad Pro, bring my Canon 40D and a big zoom lens I wanted to take, plus power supply and mice. Even fully packed it fit under a Southwest flight 737 seat (different airlines have different seating arrangements). Fully packed the bag was heavy but between the well designed shoulder straps, chest strap and extremely well designed belt with hip support. I was able to comfortably carry the pack fully loaded around the airport without a problem. When I was out and about with just the camera it was awesome and easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic deal! A sturdy, quality bag.
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on this backpack just a few days before a big international trip and boy am I glad I did! It's sturdy, versatile, and secure. I have used it with a single DSLR and lenses, a single DSLR plus drone, and 2 DSLRs, typically with a laptop and tablet as well. I appreciate the modular nature of camera section, which offers total customization, and the secure straps. In the past six months, it has survived two intercontinental trips and countless hours thrown around in the car and worn on the trail. I was very pleased to find that it fits perfectly under an airplane seat!
customer_reviews.author: @foreignphotographist

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like it....
customer_reviews.text: The inside of this bag has good padding and a nice amount of room for my lenses and accessories. I have much more expensive bags that do not have as much padding. The wide waist belt id not removable. This makes the straps hard to manage if you are not using them. If you expect to be changing lenes frequently then it is too much work to utilize them. There is a back pocket that is presumably for a laptop. If you fill the bag and it gets heavey, this comes unzipped and the bag pulls away from the back panel of the bag. This is concerning. There is no way to lock the zippers in order to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Many Opinions

customer_reviews.title: The "Front Pocket" doesn't hold much either and is workable at best for organizational ability
customer_reviews.text: Decent bag. Took it with me on a trip through Nicaragua with my Camera Gear. It was able to haul my tripod, surface pro tablet, camera, 2 lenses and 2 GoPros plus all the accessories. The pockets on the sides are relatively worthless for anything other than a short cable or memory cards. The "Front Pocket" doesn't hold much either and is workable at best for organizational ability. If you need an inexpensive camera bag for weekend runs, or something you aren't afraid to ruin, this is your bag.
customer_reviews.author: BENJAMIN WINOKUR

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I. LOVE. THIS. BACKPACK. It is exactly as described, very well made, sturdy, comfortable, and holds all of my things while protecting them. It has a tripod holder guys!! I was so pleased with this purchase. I upgraded from the AmazonBasics Large DSLR Gadget Bagbecause I've acquired more equipment. With all of my stuff in the backpack, it's still comfortable to wear with the padded straps and back portion. If I had to get another, I'd buy this again but I don't see it wearing down anytime soon.
customer_reviews.author: MurphsLaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pack except no snap guards to prevent the bag from falling open accidentally
customer_reviews.text: Roomy and perfect for a camera body and 2-3 lenses with flash and accessories. The bright orange interior is the perfect backdrop to locate tiny black objects. Only design drawback is the lack of snap-straps that anchor the front flap to the rear of the pack - if the zipper of the front flap gapes open accidentally the whole flap can come apart with weight and things can fall out. I can sew, so I attached two snap-open straps to reinforce the pack. Amazon could do better with the design.
customer_reviews.author: SudipDasLensation

customer_reviews.title: Using for HTC Vive travel and storage
customer_reviews.text: When i first picked this up I was concerned that my HTC Vive would not fit with all its parts/accessories. I actually had room to spare, It is extremely well cushioned, and the dividers are very easy to set up in whatever position you prefer. I have no complaints about it whatesoever, it was perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Irvin

customer_reviews.title: High capacity and customizable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bag to carry my Oculus Quest, it's accessories, my 15" laptop, it's accessories and the various cords and notebooks that I wanted to bring to the office with me. So far this bag has handled everything I've thrown at it and comes with enough dividers to make bringing my Nintendo Switch an option as well. The bag sits nice and high on my back without being too restrictive, though a method to remove the waist strap would have been an added bonus some zip ties make short work of that minor issue. I would recommend this to anyone who needs to carry a laptop as well as some bulkier electronics regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Chad Heiser

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I just wish they would sell it with more interior colors. It's only available in grey or orange, from what I can see. I bought the orange one. I'd like to get another one, but I want it to have a different color to make it easily distinguishable from the other when I'm trying to work quickly and get to what I want out of the respective camera bag. Offer it in green, purple, etc. I can get those colors from other companies, but I'd prefer to buy your brand if you offered more variety.
customer_reviews.author: GD

customer_reviews.title: Not deep enough throughout to safely store camera bodies with grips.
customer_reviews.text: This bag has a flawed design. It is deeper at its base and then more narrow up top. If you have two camera bodies with vertical battery grips it will BARELY make it in the bag and they must go at the base, so you will have to store the second camera without the lens because the bag isn't deep enough to hold them. You will have to press down firmly to close the bag. Also this bag is smaller than i hoped. I think the designers missed opportunities for pockets and whatnot. I think for 10$ more you could get a superior product - but unfortunately i leave for my trip today so I can't send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo from LA

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice bag. It came with my camera as a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice bag. It came with my camera as a camera bag, but it is really a backpack that can hold a laptop, a bulky DSLR camera, multiple lenses, filters, cords, chargers, extra batteries, and more. My only concern is that its dimensions are a bit greater than the published dimension of various airlines for a "personal article" to be carried aboard. I had no problem on SouthWest Airlines. My next trip will be on United, and the United "personal article" carry-on dimensions are less than the dimensions on this. I hope I do not have a problem, since this will be an international flight.
customer_reviews.author: RetireeTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m loving this bag. Great value for the price! I was considering a bag 3x more expensive, but after receiving this I’m so glad I didn’t get the other one! My favorite part is it fits a 15” lap in the back so the front flap is not heavy. It fits a ton of gear. My center lens is a 70-200. Fully loaded it is heavy so I won’t be hiking with this much stuff in it, but others maybe able to. Seems sturdy and it has wonderful fabrics and construction that I can tell so far. Very happy. Way to go Amazon!
customer_reviews.author: K. D.

product_meta.title: AmazonBasics DSLR Camera and Laptop Backpack Bag - 13 x 9 x 18 Inches, Black And Orange
product_meta.description:
Style:Orange Interior| Pattern Name:SingleAn Amazon Brand.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
AmazonBasics
feature_bullets: Backpack holds and protects 2 SLR camera bodies, 3-4 lenses, 17 inch laptop and additional smaller accessories
Side straps secure tripods or other bulky accessories
Customizable padded interior. Movable dividers allow for optimal storage

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars6,487 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
